request.description:
### GET Request Description

This endpoint retrieves a list of data with the following query parameters:

- `page` (number) - Specifies the page number
    
- `limit` (number) - Specifies the number of items per page
    
- `sortBy` (string) - Specifies the field to sort by
    
- `sortOrder` (string) - Specifies the sort order (e.g., ASC or DESC)
    

### Request Body

This request does not contain a request body.

### Response Body

The response is in JSON format and has the following schema:

``` json
{
    "status": "boolean",
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "_id": "string",
                "name": "string",
                "phone": "string",
                "email": "string",
                "followers": ["string"],
                "following": ["string"],
                "createdAt": "string",
                "updatedAt": "string"
            }
        ],
        "count": "number"
    }
}

 ```

### Profile GET Request

This endpoint retrieves the profile information.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response Body

The response will be in JSON format with the following schema:

``` json
{
    "status": "boolean",
    "data": {
        "_id": "string",
        "name": "string",
        "phone": "string",
        "email": "string",
        "followers": "array",
        "following": "array",
        "createdAt": "string",
        "updatedAt": "string"
    }
}

 ```

### POST Request to Discussions Base URL

This endpoint allows the user to create a new discussion with text, image, and hashtags.

#### Request Body

- `text` (string, optional): The text content of the discussion.
    
- `image` (string, optional): The URL of the image attached to the discussion.
    
- `hashtags` (array of strings, optional): An array of hashtags associated with the discussion.
    

#### Response

The response is in JSON format and follows the schema below:

``` json
{
    "status": true,
    "data": {
        "userId": "",
        "text": "",
        "image": "",
        "hashtags": [""],
        "viewCount": 0,
        "likes": [],
        "_id": "",
        "createdOn": "",
        "createdAt": "",
        "updatedAt": ""
    }
}

 ```

The response includes a boolean `status` indicating the success of the request, and the `data` object containing the details of the newly created discussion, including `userId`, `text`, `image`, `hashtags`, `viewCount`, `likes`, `_id`, `createdOn`, `createdAt`, and `updatedAt`.

### Get Discussions

This endpoint retrieves a list of discussions based on the specified criteria.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{DISCUSSIONS_BASE_URL}}/?page=1&limit=10&sortBy=viewCount&sortOrder=DESC`
    
- Query Parameters:
    - page (number): The page number for paginated results.
        
    - limit (number): The maximum number of discussions to be returned.
        
    - sortBy (string): The field by which the discussions are sorted.
        
    - sortOrder (string): The order in which the discussions are sorted (ASC or DESC).
        

#### Response

The response is in JSON format and follows the schema below:

``` json
{
  "status": "boolean",
  "data": {
    "data": [
      {
        "_id": "string",
        "text": "string",
        "image": "string",
        "hashtags": ["string"],
        "viewCount": "number",
        "likes": ["string"],
        "createdOn": "string",
        "createdAt": "string",
        "updatedAt": "string"
      }
    ],
    "count": "number"
  }
}

 ```

request.description:
### GET /tags

This endpoint retrieves discussions based on the specified tag.

#### Request

No request body parameters are required. The query parameter "tags" should be provided to specify the tag for which discussions are requested.

- `tags` (string, required): The tag for which discussions are requested.
    

#### Response

The response is a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
    "status": boolean,
    "data": [
        {
            "_id": string,
            "userId": string,
            "text": string,
            "image": string,
            "hashtags": [string],
            "viewCount": integer,
            "likes": [string],
            "createdOn": string,
            "createdAt": string,
            "updatedAt": string
        }
    ]
}

 ```

- `status` (boolean): Indicates the status of the response.
    
- `data` (array): An array of discussion objects containing the following fields:
    - `_id` (string): The unique identifier of the discussion.
        
    - `userId` (string): The user ID associated with the discussion.
        
    - `text` (string): The text content of the discussion.
        
    - `image` (string): The URL of the image associated with the discussion.
        
    - `hashtags` (array of strings): An array of hashtags associated with the discussion.
        
    - `viewCount` (integer): The count of views for the discussion.
        
    - `likes` (array of strings): An array of user IDs who have liked the discussion.
        
    - `createdOn` (string): The date of creation of the discussion.
        
    - `createdAt` (string): The timestamp of the creation of the discussion.
        
    - `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp of the last update to the discussion.

### DELETE /comment/:commentId

This endpoint is used to delete a specific comment by its ID.

#### Request
No request body is required for this request.

- `:commentId` (path parameter) - The ID of the comment to be deleted.

#### Response
The response is in JSON format and has the following schema:
```json
{
    "status": "boolean",
    "data": {
        "message": "string"
    }
}
```
- `status` (boolean) - Indicates the status of the operation. `true` if successful, `false` otherwise.
- `data.message` (string) - A message indicating the result of the operation. It may be empty if no specific message is provided.
